item.description:
Portland Museum of Art

Here are the detail about the exhibits that will be there during this time!

Anna Hepler
July 24, 2010 - October 17, 2010

In July, contemporary Maine artist Anna Hepler, will construct a monumental installation inside the Museum’s Great Hall. Made from a nest-like mesh of salvaged and sewn sheet plastic, The Great Haul will take advantage of the Museum’s expansive entry space. A second exhibition of Hepler’s work, on view in the 4th floor gallery, will feature a series of cyanotype prints (or blue prints) made from digital photographs of small sculptures, and like her large installations, these works are defined by light. This will be Hepler’s first solo exhibition at the Portland Museum of Art.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be standing outside the entrance on Free St. between 6:45 and 7:05. After that, we will be in the museum enjoying the beautiful artwork!
item.name: Portland Museum of Art
